data.title: Will Bangkok become a walking and cycling paradise?
data.description: With stakeholder feedback now in, the city’s fathers move forward with plans to implement the Bangkok Master Plan for Walking and Cycling

data.title: BYD marks 10,000th EV produced in Thailand after just 4 months
data.description: Chinese automaker hits milestone after opening first Thai factory in July to supply local and ASEAN markets

data.title: Fine dust exceeds safety standard in 56 areas of Bangkok
data.description: As the dry season kicks in, levels of PM2.5 dust start to rise, with 56 areas in metropolitan Bangkok exceeding safety standards

data.title: Likely Bank of Thailand chairman thanks both supporters and critics
data.description: While his appointment has yet to be officially confirmed, Finance Ministry is confident Kittirat Na-Ranong will be installed soon

data.title: PM, Western Digital discuss setting up R&D centre in Bangkok
data.description: Leading manufacturer of hard disk drives expresses interest in upping its investment in Thailand during meeting with PM

data.title: Seminar boosts upgrading of urban areas as smart cities
data.description: Players in the development of smart cities talk about what has been done so far and how artificial intelligence will play an even greater role in the future

data.title: Loy Krathong goes digital in Bangkok to protect the environment
data.description: Digital Loy Krathong festivals are to be held in four venues across Bangkok to meet the demand of those who want to preserve Thai culture without causing an impact on the environment.

data.title: Bridging agriculture and renewable energy
data.description: Agriculture is a key sector in Thailand, however, it contributes to a significant number of environmental issues, particularly greenhouse gas emissions. As the world's population grows, the need for both food and clean energy increases.

data.title: 'Disrupt Health Impact Fund' invests in DiaMonTech's non-invasive glucose tech
data.description: Disrupt Technology Venture, also known as Disrupt, continues to strengthen the healthcare ecosystem with its Disrupt Health Impact Fund, launched in May 2024.

data.title: Bangchak enters SAF supply agreement with Shell
data.description: Bangchak Corporation has entered a sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) supply agreement with Singapore-based Shell International Eastern Trading Company. Under this agreement, ISCC EU/CORSIA certified SAF will be supplied to Shell, supporting sustainable aviation.

data.title: Low-altitude flights help to beat traffic woes
data.description: A helicopter that took off from a downtown area in Shenzhen, Guangdong province, at about 12.10pm on Oct 31 landed successfully at a helipad in Guangzhou's Haixinsha Park after about 30 minutes of flying.

data.title: Thais lead the way in AI integration, remote work, shows new report
data.description: Thai travellers are setting global standards for the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and working remotely, with a significant majority already planning their holidays for the upcoming year.

data.title: K-drama actor Song Jae-rim dies at 39
data.description: South Korean actor Song Jae-rim, who acted in blockbuster television dramas, including The Moon Embracing The Sun, died on Nov 7 at the age of 39.

data.title: Low-altitude flights help to beat traffic woes
data.description: A helicopter flies along the recently launched low-altitude flight route linking Shenzhen's downtown area and Guangzhou Haixinsha Park to Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport in Guangzhou, Guangdong province, at the end of October. [CHINA DAILY]

data.title: K-drama actor Song Jae-rim dies at 39
data.description: SEOUL - South Korean actor Song Jae-rim, who acted in blockbuster television dramas, including The Moon Embracing The Sun, died on Nov 7 at the age of 39.

data.title: Bangchak Enters SAF Supply Agreement with Shell
data.description: Bangchak Corporation Public Company Limited (Bangchak) has announced that they have entered into a sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) supply agreement with Singapore-based Shell International Eastern Trading Company (Shell). The agreement stipulates the offtake of ISCC EU/CORSIA certified SAF to be delivered to Shell.

data.title: Ignite your curiosity at Singapore Writers Festival
data.description: Running for its 27th edition, Singapore Writers Festival (SWF) 2024 is now open and runs until Sunday. Organised by Arts House Limited and commissioned by the National Arts Council, SWF 2024 explores the theme "In Our Nature" through over 200 thought-provoking and innovative programmes.

data.title: Celebrate Loy Krathong on the Chao Phraya
data.description: Everyone is invited to celebrate Loy Krathong at 10 cultural heritage waterfronts along the curve of the Chao Phraya River during the Bangkok River Festival 2024, which will kick off tomorrow and run until Saturday, from 4pm to 10pm. On Loy Krathong day, however, the festival will run until midnight.

data.title: Chemical reaction
data.description: The situation of local fruit vendors has gone from bad to worse after the Thai Pesticide Alert Network (Thai-PAN) released its finding two weeks ago, revealing chemical contamination in popular Shine Muscat grapes.

data.title: Driver rams his car into crowd in China, killing 35
data.description: Police say he was upset about his divorce

data.title: DHL International Multimodal Hub launched at Suvarnabhumi Airport
data.description: DHL Global Forwarding Thailand, the freight-specialist arm of DHL Group, has unveiled its new International Multimodal Hub, claiming it marks a significant advancement in the kingdom's logistics capabilities.

data.title: Opera to recall King Chulalongkorn’s royal visit to Europe in 1907
data.description: An opera at The Siam Society in Bangkok in late November will allow audiences to follow the footsteps of King Chulalongkorn’s second royal visit to Europe in 1907.

data.title: Adorable baby Phayre’s langur captures hearts online
data.description: The cute ‘doll-like’ young primate was spotted in Thung Yai Naresuan East Wildlife Sanctuary and shared on social media

data.title: Bangkok's annual light and digital-art festival back for seventh year
data.description: Festival returns to Phra Nakhon district, showcasing 36 light and digital-art installations

data.title: 2 held for modifying power meters to run bitcoin mines in Surat Thani
data.description: Police track down suspects after Provincial Electricity Authority finds it has been defrauded out of approximately 10 million baht thanks to the tampering of meters in nine locations

data.title: Bangkok’s congestion charge model to be ready in 6 months: Suriya
data.description: Transport Ministry eyes imposing congestion charges on motorists in the heart of the capital to reduce traffic, pollution and fund train projects

data.title: Losing EPL rights to have ‘no significant impact’: True Corp
data.description: After May 2025, EPL licence will be given to Jasmine International, which outbid True

data.title: Loy Krathong expected to draw 36% more flights than last year
data.description: Flight bookings to Thailand are expected to surge by 36% during the Loy Krathong festival, which falls on Friday, November 15, government deputy spokesman Karom Polpornklang said on Monday.

data.title: Anger over Department of Lands’ decision on Khao Kradong, Buriram
data.description: Decision comes despite Supreme Court ruling that these lands belong to SRT; Department of Lands clarifies situation

data.title: Thais to enjoy 3 long weekends in 2025 in tourism push
data.description: The government has announced three extra public holidays next year to support the ‘Amazing Thailand Grand Tourism and Sports Year’ initiative

data.title: Sittra’s legal troubles mount as police nab close associates
data.description: CSD police arrest couple for allegedly helping him talk EuroMillions winner into transferring 39 million baht to them
